list.event: Isengard. Confrontation with Saruman. Gandalf breaks Saruman’s staff. Grima Wormtongue casts down the palantír of Orthanc. Pippin retrieves it, but Gandalf quickly takes it. Leave Isengard (ca. 4 p.m.)
Pass through the gates of Isengard. Follow the stone-paved road south
Flooded spots gradually are disappearing
Pass the pillar of the White Hand. Ents have broken the hand apart
Stone pavement ends. Highway continues
Night falls. Waxing moon rises
All around are tree stumps, weeds and thorns
Leave the Wizard’s Vale. Highway goes SSE toward the Fords
Reach the campsite of the night before. Turn west

Camp (ca. 10 p.m.). In a dale next to the south-facing slope of Dol Baran, the last hill of the northern ranges. Heather and bracken fern are turning green. While Gandalf sleeps, Pippin takes the palantír and is seen by Sauron. Gandalf plans to ride out at once with Pippin. When a Nazgûl rides over, he warns Théoden to not wait for the dawn to leave
Gandalf and Pippin return to the highway and turn south (ca. 11 p.m.)
Shadowfax reaches the west bank by the Fords of Isen
Midnight. Shadowfax crosses the Fords of Isen
Gandalf points out the peaks of the Thrihyrne to the south. He tells Pippin the history of the palantíri – the Seeing Stones of Gondor
Reach the road to the Deeping Coomb and Helm’s Deep. Gandalf tells Pippin to ask Gimli about the Glittering Caves of Aglarond. Gandalf urges Shadowfax to even greater speed
Cross a small stream. Brief stop. Eat
Cross second small stream
Cross third small stream
Cross fourth small stream
Cross fifth small stream
Cross sixth small stream
Cross last small stream!
Dawn. Ford the Snowbourne. Turn left on the road to Edoras
Climb to Meduseld. Nazg√ªl flies over. Pippin sleeps during the day (Mar. 6). Gandalf begins organizing the Muster of Rohan
Dusk. Return to the road. Ride east at great speed
The road curves easterly around the mountain spur behind Edoras
The Snowbourne meanders through willow trees left of the road
The road curves southeast, hugging the eastern foothills of Irensaga
Hills draw away to the south. Road continues through willows
Scattered trees broaden into a wide willow thicket where the Snowbourne meets the Entwash
Willow woods end. Road turns more south, parallels the Entwash

Reach the area called the ‘Folde’, tucked against the hills, sheltered from the west and the south. A snowcapped peak rises on the south. North across the river the wide grassy Plains of Rohan are moonlit
Road turns more to the east. Brief stop. Eat
Cross a small stream
Cross a small stream
North of the road, the Entwash, flowing more slowly in the level plains is choked with vegetation and splits into multiple braided channels
Cross a small stream. Enter the area called the ‘Fenmarch’ – a wetter area, especially north of the road where the Entwash becomes sluggish and starts to expand outward into a delta
Cross a small stream
South of the road great oak trees begin to appear – outliers of Firien Wood. Camp during day (Mar. 7)
Leave at dusk
Northeast across the plain (80 miles away) the East Wall of Rohan and the Western Emyn Muil could be seen if it were daylight
Cross the Mering Stream: Gondor. Enter the heart of the Firien Wood.
The Beacon of Halifirien lies right of the road on a hill which rises above the trees
Leave Firien Wood

Cross a small stream. The Beacons are Lit: far to the east Pippin spots the beacon of Amon Dîn as it is lit. Almost immediately the beacon fires to the west are ignited. Gandalf explains the beacons to Pippin
The snowcapped peak above Calenhad rises to the right, lit by the nearly full moon
The beacon tower of Calenhad stands on a foothill of Canlenhad peak. The beacon fires are now extinguished. Brief stop. Eat
Cross a small stream
Cross a small stream. The beacon hill of Minrimmon is on the right
To the north the delta of the Entwash has broadened to over 50 miles. Rauros lies beyond, 100 miles away. Setting moon lights mists over the fens
High above to the south rise the sawtoothed tips of Rimmon – the highest peak in the eastern White Mountains
Dawn. Camp near the beacon hill of Erelas (day of Mar. 8)
Leave at dusk
Cross a small stream
Pass the beacon on Nardol, the ‘Fire Hill.’
Cross a small stream – the last which empties into the delta of the Entwash. West edge of Drúadan Forest south of the road
Eilenach beacon stands on a steep hill to the south, rising above the trees of Drúadan Forest
Brief stop. Eat
Road curves slightly to the south. Due east across the Anduin the peaks of the Ephel Dùath stand dark against the moonlit sky
The beacon hill Amon Dîn is 5 miles due south
Road curves still more south around Amon Dîn
Road runs SE. The thickets of the Grey Wood begin right of the road
The Morgul Vale lies 35 miles due east
The Grey Wood ends
Mt. Mindolluin is visible to the southwest, lit by the predawn glow
Dawn. Gandalf is challenged by the guards at the gate of the Rammas Echor: the wall surrounding the Pelennor Fields. Repairs are underway.
Reach the Gates of Minas Tirith
